column4: how do i get gnome to stop loading applications upon logging in? pidgin and amorak launch automatically
sessions
its unchecked
Krimpet , neither of those programs are listed for startup, and "remember application.." is unchecked
remove it, also remove them from current session, if they are there.
i just said they werent
okay, then are they there in ~/.xinitrc or ~/.xsession or something like that?

where are those files
if they are not there in your home directory then you are fine. post a screenshot of your sessions dialog window
the window that lists the startup programs?
the window that lists the startup programs? and where can i post/
imageshack, flickr

and under current session tab?

because, some of those apps, will have property set that restart the program on new gnome-session, you need to disable that for amarok or whatever program you don't want to restart when gnome starts
